title: Soundtrack for indie game ”35mm”
description: “Eternity, in common parlance, is an infinite amount of time that never ends or the quality, condition or fact of being everlasting or eternal. Classical philosophy, however, defines eternity as what is timeless or exists outside time, whereas sempiternity corresponds to infinite duration. ” (c) Wikipedia

First of all, when I started to develop and write the soundtrack for the game on request of indie game developer «35mm» Sergei Noskov, I with great enthusiasm immersed myself in listening and analyzing the references he asked to orient. It was the music of such a famous composer as Eduard Artemiev for the films of Andrei Tarkovsky «Stalker» and «Solyaris». In several compositions I tried to convey a similar atmosphere, even using digital imitations of the 80s' vintage synths.

As for modern artists, I have already relied on my own tastes and preferences. Carbon Based Lifeforms, 36, Astropilot and other artists of the ambient genre perfectly complemented the list of inspirations that convey an atmosphere of eternity and post-apocalyptic mood.

My friend, an expert in electronic experimental music Sergei Grishin was a partner in the creation of several compositions. His experience in darkside was very useful in creating music for the most disturbing moments of the game.
But the main inspiration of course I got from Sergei Noskov’s own game. Screenshots from the game and other photos and whole albums that Sergei shared with me.
Release Year : 2016

title: Soundtrack for indie game “The Light Remake”
description: «The Light is a remake of the original 2012 game, an atmospheric author’s parable about our place in this world, life and death. Explore a mysterious territory filled with a variety of details that reveal the story. Solve logic puzzles and explore text messages.» (с)

Four years after our successful collaboration for the first time on a game «35mm» indie developer Sergei Noskov called me again to create the soundtrack for his next game "The Light Remake". This time the protracted ambient replaced the live orchestral compositions. Even some alternative rock and darkside music took place.

It was possible to keep the atmosphere of post-apocalypse and convey the necessary dramatic moments of the game. Referents for the game were compositions of such outstanding composers as Ludovico Einaudi, Tomas Newman, Franz Liszt, "Brother 2" OST movie and others.
Release Year : 2020

title: Byte Bumbling Boogie
description: Participated as volunteer in contest of indie developers at GCUP forum as a sound engineer and music composer for 2d pixel art platformer game. Created 3 compositions in chiptune\lo-fi style and sounds for the game.
At the end, the game won the competition in the category «Special award - GCUP selection» among 23 participants who reached the final.
This is part of full OST for the game. 1/3 track.
Release Year : 2013

title: Starbucks

This was a final my coursework of this course.

description: You could:

2. Record your voice and minus together.
3. Record your instrument and voice
4. etc.
If you record voice and music separately result could be much better.
